page.title: 11FERGUSON PRINTERS
page.content: Opened in 1824 by Joseph Ferguoen the firm was at first only a small concern specialising in dyeing and finishing cotton. However it was to expand by the 1940's to be a major employer with a work force of over 1200 men an women.However today after numerous changes and cutbacks the firm employs just over 300 men and women and concentrates its activities on weaving dyeing and printing. The firm today is owned by Vantona Viyella which is one of the largest textile groups in the country.However the company still trades under the name of Ferguson Printers specialising in the production of high quality house hold textiles. Since 1983 significant capital investment has been made at the Holme Head works in new equipment.
